intro: Bistorta pseudosuffulta, commonly known as the false bistort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, slightly hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a prominent midrib. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Bistorta pseudosuffulta is often found in moist meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges, where it thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions.
